description: Accommodations, trips, overnight, Travel, hotel, places to go, outdoors, events, motels, sports activities

reviews.title: Master of Fishing / Genuine Guide
text: Taro is an absolute legend. This guy not only understands fish and their patterns, but has an open mind. He is knowledgeable of his gear and more importantly how to entertain his clients. Taro took my girlfriend (beginner fisherlady) and I (intermediate fisherman) out on Lake Ontario for smallmouth bass and it was nothing short of the best day I've had fishing. Not only did he take the time to teach my girlfriend how to properly cast/retrieve a bait but he set her up for that  smallmouth bite that she's been itching to experience. Myself on the other hand, I took away valuable knowledge and tips that I could have never gained if I didn't book this trip. Taro genuinely loves what he does and it's evident he's successful. Cheers to future success buddy. Do yourself a favour and book a trip with him now!

reviews.title: Catching that Bucket List Smallmouth bass.
text: Even though it was pouring rain when we arrived at our prearranged location, Taro was ready to get out on the lake the minute the rain cleared.  We were able to land19 quality bass in the 3 hours we had before the rains resumed, but best of all, we each caught a 4+ pound Smallie!Taro was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about where to find fish.  He was patient with me, a less experienced angler, and just as respectful of my husband who has more experience in the sport. We thoroughly enjoyed this fishing experience, and would highly recommend Taro's Fish City Tours to anyone.

reviews.title: Rainbow Trout and Tight Lines All Day Long - Shore Lunch to Finish
text: My boys and I were keen for a fishing trip and hoping for a shore lunch to boot! Taro Murata is a 100% PRO and his spirited character keep the pace of the day between hits. WAIT... The hits never stopped. Fish after fish hit baits as he rolled through his repertoire of bait du jour. Honestly, I'd go out on the water just to spend the day with this guy and hang out, but if you're looking for shore-lunch, TARO will deliver!

reviews.title: A great day of fall fishing on lake Simcoe
text: I wanted to get my dad out on the water fishing as we were having a nice warm September.  The last time I was out with Taro smallmouth bass fishing our 5 fish bag would have been over 37lbs!  I'm not joking!  How do you top that?

We met at the dock and our adventure began.  Conditions were overcast with some light wind and we started off targeting largemouth bass.  Right away were onto the fish!  after a few hours the largemouth conditions changed but Taro compensated and kept us active bringing in the biggest perch I have ever seen!  We then did some dock skipping for largemouth bass.  Very fun technical fishing.  The largemouth bass fishing started to slow down with the wind and the overcast sky.  The sun came out and the lake became as flat as glass.  Taro mixed it up again for us and put us onto my favorite...Smallies!  The action was back up and popping again!
We also brought some pike and a bulldog catfish into the boat.
Overall it was a great day with my retired father and Taro.  We took some great pictures and Taro even cleaned up some of those chunky perch for us to take home.
I will be standing in line to go on this ride again.  I don't care how long it is!
These perch were the size of running shoes. Don't believe me?  Pictures on my instagram @mclovetts75.

reviews.title: Great adventure
text: My best fishing experience.
The guides name is Taro. He's the real deal and loves what he does and it shows.
We pulled in over 60 fish!!! And I don't even think that was a good day for this awesome Guide.
You'll Love it!

reviews.title: Travelling from Australia it was awesome to have a guide like Taro
text: I was lucky enough to be able to head out with Taro while i was in Toronto. Travelling half way round the world from Australia i've always wanted to catch Largemouth and Smallmouth Bass. I was not disappointed with my full days guide with Taro. He got me onto the fish and was very friendly and plenty of laughs were had. He was willing to go with the flow and allowed me to try any technique i wanted to and always got me to areas that were productive. If your ever near Toronto and wanted a half day for full days guide I can highly recommend  Fish City Tours. He taught me some new techniques that i can't wait to try on the species back home. We caught fish all day. If i'm every back in the Toronto area i will be definitely booking another tour with Taro.

reviews.title: 5 reasons why you need to book with Taro
text: I found Fish City Tours and Taro on social media and I decided to pull the trigger and hire him for a 5 hour charter.  My wife and I had the pleasure of spending last sunday morning with Taro on Rice Lake while we DOMINATED THE WATER!  Needless to say, I would recommend him and these are the top five reasons why:
1. He catered the experience to what we wanted

My wife and are are on different spectrums of fishing excellence and he was able to keep us both happy.  He recognized that I wanted to really actively smash the fish, while my wife was content to bait drag, vertical jig and just chill.  When my wife decided that she wanted to fish more actively, Taro taught her how to do that.
2. Taro is a Jedi Master, and a great teacher

He was able to teach my wife about the basics like casting, how to jig, how to set the hook and different things to expect while fishing.  For me it was cool to pick his brain about what he is looking for in fishing spots.  He was able to teach me concepts and techniques that I can use next time I go fishing.  When I go fishing, i dont have a fish finder, GPS or all the other fancy electronics, but he showe me key things to look for.
3. He knows what he is talking about

To be a good teacher you have to have a to know what you are talking about, and Taro knows!  There was a point where during the day where I just lost a fish, and after that the fishing slowed for a bit.  So he made an adjustment, and on the first cast after it was FISH ON!
4. He puts you on Fish!

As I said earlier, we were on the water for 5 hours and in that time I caught 25 plus fish.  Honestly I lost count after 15. The action didn't start out so hot, so we tired different presentations, baits/ lures.  Once  he found the pattern, it was lights out!
5. He is an overall good Dude!

Taro is easy to get a long with.  He kept the vibe on the boat light and he took time to get to know my wife and I. He talked about his wife and his kids, his love for Nike's and shared a few fish stories.  He is definitely a people person.

I have been on other fishing charters with different guides and companies over the last couple of years and by far, this one was the best. I will defintely recomend Fish City Tours and I will be booking again.

reviews.title: Awesome day fishing with Taro
text: Spent a day fantastic chasing pike with Taro on Lake Ontario. Boat was well equipped and will only get better as a new boat is scheduled to arrive the week after my charter. Fishing gear was in excellent working order and included quality tackle from Shimano, G. Loomis and St Croix. Taro had a massive selection of lures and worked really hard all day to get the best result possible for the client. Many lure and position changes. Taro used all of the technology at his disposal, including several fish finders and an underwater camera, to find the fish. Weather was tricky but despite that we ended up with 7 pike. The largest was a 37" 12 lb. monster which was landed on 6lb. test nylon monofilament. 2 other fish over 7 lbs and nothing less than 3 lb. Would highly recommend Taro to anyone visiting Toronto. He really knows his stuff and shares his knowledge readily. The day will last long in my memory.

reviews.title: Happy beginners
text: We are beginners who caught our first northern pike in Lake Ontario with Taro Murata. Great fishing experience in the GTA; caught plenty of spring pike in rain and sunshine! Taro is a knowledgable and entertaining guide, you won't be disappointed. Book him in advance!

reviews.title: Best Day of Fishing Ever!
text: Just came back from an absolutely epic day on the water with Fish City Tours! I had heard/read phenomenal reviews about Taro, but the actual experience far exceeded my expectations. We started the day bright and early targeting Spring Pike - despite horrible rainy/cold conditions, we landed 5 fish and lost a bunch more in the first few hours of fishing. I was delighted with this result but Taro was not happy - we made some adjustments to our approach and switched locations. The move paid off big time - I had the single most productive afternoon of fishing I have ever had in my life, landing a number of big fish (brown trout, steelhead, carp, freshwater drum, smallmouth bass) in the span of a few hours - the action was non-stop and my arms were exhausted. I have hired many guides across North America - but I have never seen this level of dedication to customer service. Taro is undoubtedly one of the most knowledgeable guides I have every fished with and the knowledge I took away from this trip will pay dividends for many trips to come. He is a genuinely nice guy (hilarious as well!) who has the utmost passion for his craft and really cares about sharing it with his customers. He goes more than the extra-mile and really cares about making the trip a very memorable experience for his customers. I cannot wait to book the next trip with Fish City Tours in the summer! Thanks Taro! Dean

reviews.title: Scotty Bowman + Bill Walsh of Angling
text: Man/woman/young/old/Bassmaster/Noob/groups/solo it doesn't matter, Taro will put you on fish and lots of them. He'll teach you more than any angler I've met, but he'll also leave you to your own devices if you know your techniques. I've fished with him close to 20 times over the past four or five years and have caught hundreds and hundreds of fish. 40-"+50" Muskies, beast Northerns, 9lb Walleyes, mammoth Buckets and Smallies, Trout, Steelies, Drum, Carp, White Bass, Crappie, Rainbows, Bowfins, hell I even caught a +2lb beastmode Rock Bass with him. It doesn't matter. He's fished with the greatest (Izumi and Saric to name two) because he is one of the greatest of all time. He's also a great guy and a lot of fun to fish with. I'm 10 times the angler I was prior to meeting Taro. He's like The Wiz, nobody beats him

reviews.title: Great fishing experience
text: I have fished with Taro of Fish City Tours many times and have always caught a lot  of big fish from crappies, perch, bass, muskies , walleye, pike to salmon. I have learned a lot of new techniques and have become a better fisherman. I would definitely recommend Taro for an exciting , informative day of fishing !

reviews.title: Like everyone else says.....
text: This guy knows his stuff and you will catch fish. Whether you are an experienced fisherman/woman or not, you will finish the day having learned something new and be infected by Taro's enthusiasm and passion for the sport.

reviews.title: Fish whisperer? Fish Jedi!
text: This guy knows! Its just that simple! Species doesn't matter, Taro knows where they are and how to get them.  Want to step up your game? Get on the water with this guy and be prepared to learn. Experienced anglers, women, kids, doesn't matter, he has the knowledge and personality to make it day on the water you wont forget. Very humble and down to earth, no attitude.   Each time I have gone, I have caught a new personal best Muskie... and fished up walleye on the same day.  Multispecies master is right!  I guess the only question is....what are you waiting for?

reviews.title: Multispecies master !
text: I have now fished with Taro several times. What keeps me coming back is the priceless knowledge I acquire every time I get in the boat with Taro. You can read as many fishing magazines you want, watch all the shows, and you still learn more in just 1 day with Taro !
He has brought my fishing game to the next level !

Additionally, Taro is a great boat captain, and has kept me feeling safe in some of the worst weather out there. He spares no expense on anything but the highest quality rods, reels, and gear on the market.

reviews.title: "Unbelievable"
text: This guy is unreal !! Put us right on the fish, caught giant bronzebacks / donkeys all day long, great personality and a blast to fish with ! Taro your the man !!! We will definetly be going out again with you soon I'd recommend him highly !!

reviews.title: He's Called the Fish Whisperer - Severe Understatement
text: There is no one better to fish with out there period. I have fished with Taro twice, 1 full day and 1 half day. A total of about 60 fish or higher were caught. I put anywhere beween 30-60 days on the water fishing a year and Taro quite frankly makes you a better fisherman. Hes not your standard guide who does all the work, hooks the fish and then lets you reel. The rod is in your hands, you cast, you , hook and you reel. The techniques he teaches you are worth the money. The fish are a bonus. On our first trip we caught a 10lb carp within the first 10 seconds of our line being in the water. Not to mention the place he took us; I still talk about as fishing Heaven.

I hooked up with a 6 1/2 lb largemouth on our last outing all from the knowledge taro passed over. I would book a charter every week with him if I could. No one out there can beat the Value that you get from Taro.
Do yourself the biggest favour of your life and your fishing career: Only ever book with Taro.
Matt D.

reviews.title: Taro is a GENIUS
text: If you are thinking about joining Taro on his beauty alumacraft boat then think no more and just book it, I've never had a better day on the water then the two times I"ve been on a fish city tour charter. Great day and an even better guide. Its worth every penny to go. Taro Murata is pure class and alot of fun to fish with.
find him on twitter and instagram and the pictures prove my reasoning for this review.

reviews.title: Amazing fishing and priceless memories !
text: Had seen the pictures and read the reviews. Assumed that the photos were of the exceptional or the fortunate. It turns out that there are big fish in the lake we fished and Taro knew how to find them . Better yet - and most impressive -he knew how to teach the novice fishermen in our group to catch them, and the more experienced to adapt their techniques to the fish being sought- comfortably , with patience and humour . The result- everyone caught fish , and everyone caught LARGE fish .One member -who hadn't intended to fish and tried at the last minute - was as successful as all the others. Some of the group pulled up the largest fish they had ever caught.
Superlatives have to be used to describe this experience. Bottom line- this experience was fun , and it delivered what was promised - large fish and priceless memories.

reviews.title: He did it AGAIN   :)
text: Taro is just a freak when it comes to sniffing out where the fish are and so versatile in how to get the bite going.  He has taught me many methods to catch fish and grow my confidence.
Thanks Taro

reviews.title: As good as guides get!!
text: I suppose I should preface this by saying that have been fortunate enough to fish all over the world with countless different people and you will not find many like Taro.  I am from New Jersey and I was led to Taro on my hunt for giant smallmouth.   His knowledge of his fishery is absolutely second to none.  He is incredibly in tune and knows what it takes to get bites in any given conditions.  The first time I fished with him last fall he put my on my personal best smallmouth many times in the 3 days. I caugh many life time smallmouth until the very end of my last day when I landed a 7lb 10oz GIANT.  He knew exactly the type of trip I was looking for and it could not have gone any better. I had such a great time I booked 3 more days in the spring and I will be back again this year (and many more).  Beyond the incredible fishing I can assure you all of thre things....1) Even the most experienced anglers in the world will learn something from fishing with Taro.  NO QUESTION.  2) There will be no shortage of entertainment.  His experience/stories are often beyond belief (but undoubtedly true).  You are sure to laugh ALL day long regardless of fishing conditions.  3) You will gain a friend in this man, he is one of the most likable guys I have met thus far.  Honest, hard working, and as fun as they come.  I'll be back soon!

reviews.title: Best guide in the world
text: His love for fishing his knowledge about the sport and his charm will insure an amazing experience! ! I only take Taro can't ask for anyone better

reviews.title: Musky hunting
text: I was lucky enough to take some guys from work after I put up a united way auction. taro took us out on kawartha lakes (Pigeon) and we all caught musky no 10000 cast each it was awesome. Since then I have caught Salmon, Pike, bass its never a dull moment and taro's laugh is infectious, awesome Guide and every day I look forward to learning from him.

reviews.title: Fishing trip of a life time!!!!!
text: I have never gone fishing before but once I found out my highschool friend was Fish City Tours I jumped on it. I went with Taro and my dad. It was one of the most memorable experiences of my life, had an amazing time and caught myself a few monsters. Once again thanks to Taro for a memorable day.....

reviews.title: Best fishing guide in Southern Ontario
text: I have booked Taro a bunch of times and each time I have caught a beast.  This dude knows his stuff and is a pleasure to spend a day on the water with.  You will laugh and cry, but most importantly you will Catch.

reviews.title: Taro is "The Fish Whisperer"
text: I had one request... I wanted to catch my personal best walleye... Taro delivered not once, but three times during our trip. Despite my partner Mark not feeling so good due to some stag party drinking the night before, Taro was in great spirits and made the trip fun for all of us... We caught numerous fish in the 10+ pound class and my new PB was a 12.4 Lb behemoth. What an awesome day and what a truly talented guide. Fishing with Taro, you'll notice that he never stops thinking...never for a moment does he cease to look for another edge...he'll get that look in his eye and he's gone...whispering to the fish...."Here fishy fishy".... sounds crazy yes, but for Taro, it works!! I recommend Taro and Fish City Tours without hesitation and I can't wait for my next trip!

reviews.title: Best fishing experience ever!
text: Fishing with Taro was such a jaw-dropping experience! It was the funnest day on the water while catching fish constantly.  Taro taught me how to catch fish in so many different ways I never knew existed.  He knows how to search, find, and hook up with different species if fish.  I HIGHLY recommend booking a trip with Taro.

reviews.title: Best fishing guide available anywhere!
text: If you ever wondered what it would feel like to nab a 40" Muskie or spend a day catching 5-7 pound small-mouth bass then stop wondering and book a trip with this guy! Taro will put you on these fish and more. If your new to angling or a pro looking to hone your skills, Taro is the man to teach you what you need and should know. A very friendly and welcoming experience with non stop fish and laughs all day. I  myself have done several trips with Taro and will continue to do so!

reviews.title: What a Guy
text: This guy knows his stuff, it dosen't matter what you want to fish, he will put you on them
You will learn and laugh
Great times with Taro

reviews.title: Best guide ever! !
text: Been several times now.  He is an amazing  fisherman and an awesome  guy.  Not only will you have the best fishing experience you will ever have you will also have a fun time. He is really funny  and cares about  his clients. Highly  recommend to anyone

reviews.title: Best Days Ever
text: I've fished with Taro twice now and have just booked a third day with him for May.  The first time out I brought along my business partner.  The weather was cold but Taro had all the gear to keep us warm and keep the fish biting.  Last summer I brought along my spouse and son.  We fished all day and caught smallies and large mouth bass, perch, catfish and rock bass.  A great day with Taro, a fantastic fisherman and person.  I can't wait for the next fishing trip with Taro in a few months.  Taro and Fish City Tours get my highest recommendation.  Jonathon

reviews.title: Great experience
text: It was amazing watching my two kids catch fish for the first time. The looks on their faces was priceless. Taro our guide was very hands on and taught and showed us the proper techniques. Look forward to using Taro's services again

reviews.title: Most amazing experince
text: I went on a fishing trip with Taro and it was the most pleasant experience I ever had. We went out in the morning, it was actually dark out when we met him. The weather was a little cold but we decided to go out anyways. I had not gone fishing I a long time and i can truly say that since I was a kid I liked fishing but because of my busy schedule I never really had a chance to get out but with Fish City Tours it was an amazing feeling to be able to actually get away from my everyday routine and enjoy a day of relaxation. We went out all day on lake Simcoe and we caught a lot of nice fishes. Most of them were fairly large size but we didn't catch no monsters (lol). He is very knowledgable in what to do and how to catch the fish and what to use for what kind of a fish. I also want to emphasis that he was very professional and educated about the marine life and different species of fish in Ontario and made me really interested in the outdoor experience. I would definitely go out with him again very soon and I recommend Fish City Tours to anyone who wants to go out for a good time.

reviews.title: Great day on the lake and good times with Taro!
text: We had a great day on the lake with Taro. His passion for fishing made our excursion even more enjoyable. We learned so much from him! We were new to fishing at this level and he was very patient and took the time to help us get the hang of it. He also knew exactly where to go on Lake Simcoe to find the fish and he was just as excited as we were with our catches! Was a great experience overall and I think would make for a good gift idea too. Definitely would like to re-book to experience a different season and different type of fish! Thanks Taro!

reviews.title: The Best In The Business!
text: All I can say is that my two boys can't stop talking about our day with Fish City Tours!  It was one of the most funny and memorable days for us as a family!  Highly recommended!  Highly personable!

reviews.title: Bad fishing with Taro(Charlie) [--]
text: This Taro has a good sense of fishing. HE HAS VERY LIMITED ABILITY TO UNDERSTAND HIS Guided client.
He insists that during the fishing trip I had to share the boat with another fisherman?
He insisted I had to fish a certain lure. If I didn't fish his recommended lure he would start swearing and making mocking condescending comments.
I made a bad cast and got a lure stuck in a tree . He would not stop the boat and made a dismissive comment about my fishing line when it broke.
Later we switched to another Kawartha lake and instead of boating over to a shore washroom he gets out of the boat and craps in the lake?
THe zany fishing experience continued with his insistence that we had to fish for black crappie? This was a muskie fishing trip! Later he gets the largest muskie on his line

and it jumps and completely rips his lure off! So much for his choice of quality terminal  tackle! THe worst part was at the end of the trip his crappy transmission on his old truck breaks down at the boat ramp at Fenlon Falls. The tow truck driver was able to fix the truck  It was a Strange Day fishing with this guy. Never again!

reviews.title: Just as good second time around!
text: Had gone on a fishing trip to Lake Simcoe  last year with a group of friends -and had caught the biggest fish ever. It was sufficiently enjoyable to book a repeat trip.

This trip- to a different lake- was just as good. But this time we were able to appreciate even more the preparation and thought that went into making this experience as memorable as it turned out to be. A.A visit to the location the day before to see that the water and fish conditions were likely to be.
B. A special expedition to collect the bait most likely to be accepted by the fish.
C. An application of a vast wealth of knowledge of the interplay among the various factors - bait , wind conditions, water temperatures, currents, depth, -and type of fish likely at the locations.
D. Adapting planned techniques to actual and changing conditions.

We , including novice , and slightly more experienced members, again caught- and released-  the biggest fish ever - even bigger than last year's big ones. No previous fishing experience is necessary as Taro adapts his instruction as necessary.
This was a highly informative and fun experience-one I would highly recommend, and more importantly, be happy to repeat.

reviews.title: Best Fishing Guide
text: My husband found out about Taro from both fishing shows and the Toronto Life magazine. As a professional fishing guide in the GTA area, Taro is well known and reputable. After had a full-day fishing tour with him on Lake Simcoe recently, we have no doubt that Taro is the most knowledgeable and passionate fishing guide we've ever gone out with. With Taro, we caught lots of giant bass that we never would have imagined possible. More than ensuring that his clients will catch lots of fish and having fun doing it, as a professional fishing guide, Taro does not hold back his knowledge on fishing. He taught us many amazing fishing techniques and valuable information on how to find the right fish. Whether you are fishing enthusiasts or just want to try it out for fun, you can't go wrong With booking a fishing trip with Taro. taro does not disappoint. Just remember that CATCH AND RELEASE is always cool!

reviews.title: Two things will happen when book Taro!
text: You will CATCH fish and you will have a great time doing it!!

My brother and I have fished with Taro on more than one occasion. Every time we fish together Taro keeps exceeding our expectations.  Not only is Taro a great fisherman but his trips are always entertaining.  You will be laughing the whole day in addition to catching lots of fish some of which might be trophies,  Taros laugh is infectious,he is quite the character and he is always keeping the mood on the boat as upbeat as possible.

Also, if you are an experienced fisherman and want to learn new techniques Taro is an e teacher.  I have been fishing for years and the techniques  that Taro has taught me is just incredible. He is passionate about his craft and is always willing to pass on the knowledge. He just wants everyone to have fun and become better fisherman.
Call him what you want. Fishing Guide. Fish Whisperer. Fishing Buddy. But overall just a great guy.

reviews.title: Fishing in downtown Toronto
text: I was so surprised with the amount and size of fish we caught in Toronto with Taro from fish city tours. Taro is an amazing guide who's passion for fishing is only surpassed by his passion for seeing his clients have a blast. I took my father on the second trip and he's still bugging me about the next trip out. Lol
Its a great day with Taro and i highly recommend hiring him for a day. He's Toronto's best kept secret.
